Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Factors Influencing Timing and Outcomes of Superior Cavopulmonary Anastomosis

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were identified from the Pediatric Heart Network’s Infant Single Ventricle trial database.

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included infants undergoing SCPA. The study was conducted across multiple centers.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to identify factors associated with the timing and surgical outcomes of the superior cavopulmonary anastomosis (SCPA) in infants with single ventricle physiology.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Age at SCPA was analyzed using Cox proportional hazards regression, and length of stay (LOS) was analyzed using multiple linear regression.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 193 subjects underwent SCPA at a median age of 5.2 months and weight of 5.9 kg.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Age at SCPA was associated with center and interstage adverse events. Longer LOS was linked to younger age and greater case complexity.

Harms.evidence: There were 3 deaths and 1 transplant during hospitalization, and 3 deaths and 3 transplants post-discharge.
